Q: What can the federal government do to support voting rights around the country? 

A: We must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act. We can, and must extend some the voting rights we enjoy in MD to the rest of our 50 states and territories.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: I am concerned about the unfinished Purple Line and when it will be complete. 
 
A: I will make sure federal dollars are not in jeopardy. I have written letters to the Governor about this issue and will make sure it's a top priority in the next infrastructure package.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: Tell me about relief for small businesses? 

A: We have streamlined and simplified access to aide in small business support. We've improved programs such as PPP and expanded eligibility categories. We have set aside money for community banks and minority lending institutions.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: How are you making our schools safe? 

A: In our Relief Package, we secured $128.5 billion in grants for elementary and secondary school reopening and stabilization. We will do everything we can to re-open safely.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: Why was it important to pass the Equality Act today? 

A: Let‚Äôs be clear, regardless of your sexual or gender orientation: all Americans should be treated equally and with dignity. I was proud to vote for this bill today.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: What are your top priorities on the Veterans Affairs Committee? 

A: In the short term, I will ensure our Veterans are getting their benefits through the relief package. Veterans need direct cash assistance and we must ensure our senior Veterans get vaccinated.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text:
Q: How will you address equity issues in the vaccine rollout?

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: Ratcheting up tensions with Iran only increases the threat of miscalculation and the chance of armed conflict. I urge the administration to strategically consider all the options with our allies to confront Iran, and prevent the needless deaths of American servicemembers.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: We cannot afford another quagmire in the Middle East; we cannot lose more Americans to a war started under false pretenses; and we cannot strengthen our national security without a strategy, or by resorting to military force to compensate for the lack of a strategy.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: If the administration believes the use of military force is merited, then they must make that case to Congress and the American people in pursuit of a new AUMF. The 2001 authorization does not grant authority to engage in armed conflict with Iran.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: The President does not have Congressional authorization to strike Iran, and I am deeply alarmed by the administration‚Äôs fishing expedition and obvious layering of spurious reasons to keep the door open for armed conflict.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: There is simply no justification for war with Iran, and the current escalation has alarming echoes of the 2003 invasion of Iraq. We cannot repeat the same mistakes that led to grave consequences at home and abroad that we are still dealing with today.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: Our current unilateral approach lacks strategic focus, makes addressing Iran‚Äôs behavior more difficult, increases the threat of direct conflict, and ensures any military action will not have the support of our allies, the global community and most importantly the American people.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: However, to confront and ultimately change Iranian behavior, we have to work with our allies to pursue an effective, multilateral effort that utilizes our economic, diplomatic, and military power.

name: Anthony Brown
tweet_text: Today I sat through my third classified briefing on escalating tensions with Iran. Iran has been and remains a hostile actor in the region. The United States can and must defend itself, stand with our allies, and protect our national security interests from Iranian hostilities.
